results.title: Any friends or relations
results.brief_description: A tractor safety film which investigates the many kinds of accidents which can happen. Shows how the operator’s personal failures can cause accidents. Gives valuable safety hints on the operation of tractors. Suitable for rural and construction

results.title: Ants
results.brief_description: Varied activities of four different types of ants; mound builders, black ants, household ants, and carpenter ants. Shows in detail the life cycle of the carpenter ant, including construction of the nest, laying of eggs, feeding of young , hatching, and preparations for swarming. Intercolony battle between mound builders and food ants.

results.title: Antonio
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of an Italian immigrant, a widower, living alone with his memories, his Bible, and Dante which he learned to read in English. He talks about his past, his children, of good times and bad. A warm portrait of an aging man who chooses freedom and independence even though it at times means solitude.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ianzelo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Anton Chekhov: a writer's life
results.brief_description: Uses photographs, contemporary footage, and excerpts from his writings to present a portrait of the Russian dramatist and short story writer, Anton Chekhov. Includes scenes from his plays and stories performed by artists from Moscow Art Theatre and the Mosfilm Studios.

results.title: Antiques at auction
results.creator_credit: Ronald Spencer and Lion Pacesetter Films
results.brief_description: Explains the workings of a modern antique sale-room, department by department. The task of selling the contents of a house is taken over by Phillips Son and Neale, who classify and catalogue the effects. The climax is the auction itself, with its central focus of the rostrum and the interplay of bidders

results.title: Anti-matter
results.creator_credit: Carlos Gutierrez-Mena, Lewis C. Hall and University of California, Los Angeles. Dept. of Physics
results.brief_description: This program explores the subject of anti-matter; its significance as a destructive process and the possibility of its constructive use. It explains matter, anti-matter and explores the possibility that large quantities of anti-matter exist in space.

results.title: Anthrax
results.brief_description: Traces the early investigation into the control of Anthrax disease in sheep and cattle. The film recalls the losses, in early days, amounting to hundreds of thousands of sheep and cattle, and then proceeds to show how the problem of this disease has been largely overcome to-day. The danger of Anthrax to humans is also stressed. No other credits available.

results.title: Antarctica 1948
results.brief_description: A record of the operations of the Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition, from November 1947 until April 1948. Meteorologists, metallurgists, geologists, zoologists and biologists took part in the expedition. A meteorological station was established on Heard Island, south of Fremantle. Another party set out for Macquarie Island, with the intention of landing on the mainland of Antarctica, to carry out a geological survey, but pack ice prevented this, making it impossible for the party to land.
results.description: A record of the operations of the Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition, from November 1947 until April 1948. results.title: Antarctic Vigil
results.creator_credit: Dept of Interior for the Australian Film Board in association with The Australian National Anatarctic Research Expedition and Film Australia
results.brief_description: An account of research undertaken by Australian scientists at the Antarctic outposts of Macquarie, Kerguelen and Heard Islands. Shows life on these islands including work at the meteorological stations and studies of the unusual animal, bird and plant life found in Arctic regions.

results.title: Antarctic crossing
results.creator_credit: George Lowe, James Carr and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: An account of the establishment and execution of the 1957-58 Commonwealth Trans-Antarctic Expedition under Sir Vivian Fuchs, with support by the New Zealand party under Sir Edmund Hillary. Includes excerpts from original films of the Scott and Shackleton Expedition by courtesy of the British Film Institute Archives.
